articles.author: Dan Knight
articles.title: 8 training routines to boost climbing performance
articles.metaDescription: 8 training routines ranging from 10 mins to 3 hours that can help push into new grades and improve endurance for long routes.
articles.summary: 8 different training routines, ranging from 10 minutes to 3 hours, that can help a climber push into new grades and improve endurance for long multi-pitch routes. This post covers the pros and cons of each as well as helpful tools to support tracking and completing them.
articles.heroAlt: Fingers hanging from a beastmaker fingerboard.
articles.heroCaption: Michel warming down with his favorite 10 min fingerboard routine, the 'no-hang'.

articles.author: Dan Knight
articles.title: Trad Climbing Protection Ranked 2026
articles.metaDescription: A review and ranked teir list of climbing protection I rely on most for traditional multipitch climbing.
articles.summary: Understanding and selecting the optimum equipment is a key part to success in traditional multi-pitch climbing. Understanding the different types of climbing gear available, and their respective strengths and weaknesses can make a huge difference to both the safety and chance of success on a route.
articles.heroAlt: Part of a trad climbing rack
articles.heroCaption: Photo: Part of a trad climbing rack on Gower sea cliffs.

articles.author: Dan Knight
articles.title: Multi-Pitch Climbing Blog | Gear, Techniques & Training
articles.metaDescription: A blog to champion the virtues of the traditional climbing ethic. Written by un-remarkable climber talking about multi-pitch gear, techniques, training and training.
articles.heroAlt: Danny Wing leading the second pitch of a granite climb in Morocco near Tafraoute.
articles.heroCaption: Photo: Danny Wing leading the second pitch of a granite climb in Morocco near Tafraoute.
